briefdescription.para: Get the type of a corto_value.

simplesect.para: The type of the specified value.

briefdescription.para: Get a pointer of a corto_value.

detaileddescription.para: The resulting pointer can be used in corto_ptr_* functions, together with the result of corto_value_typeof.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the value represented by the corto_value.

briefdescription.para: Set the corto_value to a new pointer.

detaileddescription.para: This function will not modify the value of the current pointer, but overrides the value encapsulated by the corto_value. For example, this function can set a corto_value to a new object, or new member.
It is important that the specified pointer is of the same type as the corto_value. It is illegal to set the pointer of a corto_value instance of the CORTO_LITERAL kind.

parameterdescription.para: The pointer to set for the corto_value.

briefdescription.para: Return the object associated with a specified corto_value.

detaileddescription.para: Most corto_value instances point to values in a corto_object. This object is stored as a separate field of the value, and can be obtained by this function.
The function is invalid for corto_value instances of the CORTO_LITERAL kind.

parameterdescription.para: The pointer to set for the corto_value.

briefdescription.para: Get a member from an existing composite corto_value.

detaileddescription.para: Initialize a new corto_value from an existing corto_value with a member of the existing corto_value. The function accepts a member expression in the form of foo.bar.helloworld. If the specified member is not valid for the type of the corto_value instance, the function will fail.

parameterdescription.para: A valid member expression for the type of the specified value.

briefdescription.para: Perform unary operator on a corto_value.

detaileddescription.para: The result corto_value has to at least be an initialized corto_value (use corto_value_empty for new values). The value does not have to be of a matching type. If the result corto_value owned any resources, they will be deallocated / released before assigning the new value.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the operand corto_value.
A pointer to the result corto_value.

briefdescription.para: Perform binary operator on two corto_values.

detaileddescription.para: The result corto_value has to at least be an initialized corto_value (use corto_value_empty for new values). The value does not have to be of a matching type. If the result corto_value owned any resources, they will be deallocated / released before assigning the new value.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the leftoperand corto_value.
A pointer to the right operand corto_value.
A pointer to the result corto_value.

briefdescription.para: Cast a value.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the value to cast.
A corto_value pointer to the result of the cast.

briefdescription.para: Initialize a new corto_value instance.

simplesect.para: A corto_value instance of kind CORTO_VALUE with ptr set to NULL.

briefdescription.para: Initialize a new corto_value instance holding an object.

detaileddescription.para: A value representing an object in the corto object store.

parameterdescription.para: The type of the new corto_value. The type may be different from the object type, but the object has to be an instance of the specified type.

briefdescription.para: Initialize a new corto_value instance holding a base value.

detaileddescription.para: Base corto_value instances express the base value of a value that is of a type that uses inheritance. This kind is typically used by the corto_walk API when serializing the base of a value.

Making base a separate kind, allows applications to differentiate between the full value and a base value. Older versions of the walk API used a member kind to express inheritance where the member was set to NULL, but this complicated code and was less intuitive.
It is good practice to make the parent field of a BASE corto_value (eventually) point to a value of the CORTO_OBJECT kind for objects, or CORTO_VALUE for non-object values.

parameterdescription.para: The type of the new corto_value.

briefdescription.para: Initialize a new corto_value instance holding a generic value.

detaileddescription.para: A value representing any value that does not fall in any of the other categories.

briefdescription.para: Initialize a new corto_value instance holding a member value.

detaileddescription.para: A value used to represent members of composite values.

parameterdescription.para: The object containing the member (can be NULL).
A pointer to the member value.

briefdescription.para: Initialize a new corto_value instance holding a constant value.

detaileddescription.para: A value used to represent enumeration or bitmask constants. This is typically used by the metawalk API when serializing each constant of a bitmask or enumeration type.

parameterdescription.para: The object containing the constant (can be NULL).
A pointer to the constant value.

memberdef.argsstring: (corto_object object, corto_type type, uint32_t index, void *ptr)
memberdef.name: _corto_value_element

briefdescription.para: Initialize a new corto_value instance holding an element value.

detaileddescription.para: A value used to represent elements in a collection value.

parameterdescription.para: The object containing the element (can be NULL).
A pointer to the element value.

memberdef.argsstring: (corto_object object, corto_type type, corto_type keyType, void *key, void *ptr)
memberdef.name: corto_value_mapElement

briefdescription.para: Initialize a new corto_value instance holding a map element value.

detaileddescription.para: A value used to represent map elements in a collection value.

parameterdescription.para: The object containing the element (can be NULL).
A pointer to the element value.

briefdescription.para: Initialize a new corto_value instance holding a literal.

detaileddescription.para: A value used to represent a literal of a scalar type. This function copies the provided value into the corto_value structure.

parameterdescription.para: A literal kind (CORTO_LITERAL_BOOLEAN, CORTO_LITERAL_CHARACTER, CORTO_LITERAL_INTEGER, CORTO_LITERAL_UNSIGNED_INTEGER, CORTO_LITERAL_FLOATING_POINT, CORTO_LITERAL_STRING or CORTO_LITERAL_NULL)
A pointer to the literal value.

briefdescription.para: Initialize a new corto_value instance holding a boolean literal.
Initialize a new corto_value instance holding a character literal.
Initialize a new corto_value instance holding an unsigned integer literal.
Initialize a new corto_value instance holding a signed integer literal.
Initialize a new corto_value instance holding a floating point literal.
Initialize a new corto_value instance holding a string literal.

detaileddescription.para: This function copies the provided string into the corto_value structure.

memberdef.argsstring: (corto_type leftType, bool t1ByRef, corto_type rightType, bool t2ByRef, corto_operatorKind _operator, corto_type *operandType, corto_type *resultType)
memberdef.name: corto_binaryExpr_getType

briefdescription.para: API for corto_value instances.

detaileddescription.para: Corto objects are the things that you put in the store!
